sailpoint.plugin

Class PluginsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.plugin.PluginsUtil

  • public class PluginsUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for working with plugins.

    • Method Detail

      • instantiate

        @Deprecated
public static <T> T instantiate(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                            java.lang.String className)
        Deprecated. 
        Instantiates an object with the specified class name using the class loader for the plugin with the specified name using the plugins cache owned by the Environment.

        Note that the class must have a default constructor.

        Parameters:
        pluginName - The plugin name.
        className - The class name.
        Returns:
        The new instance or null if ANY exception is thrown, parameters are missing or the plugin does not exist in the cache.

      • instantiate

        public static <T> T instantiate(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                java.lang.String className,
                                Plugin.ClassExportType classExportType)
        Instantiates an object with the specified class name using the class loader for the plugin with the specified name using the plugins cache owned by the Environment.

        Note that the class must have a default constructor.

        Parameters:
        pluginName - The plugin name.
        className - The class name.
        classExportType - make sure plugin declares the class as exported for the given export type
        Returns:
        The new instance or null if ANY exception is thrown, parameters are missing, the plugin does not exist in the cache, or the plugin didn't declare the class as exported for the given export type.

      • instantiate

        @Deprecated
public static <T> T instantiate(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                            java.lang.String className,
                                            java.lang.Object[] params,
                                            java.lang.Class<?>[] paramTypes)
        Deprecated. 
        Instantiates an object with the specified class name using the class loader for the plugin with the specified name using the plugins cache owned by the Environment.

        Note that the class must have a constructor with a signature consistent with paramTypes

        Parameters:
        pluginName - The plugin name.
        className - The class name.
        params - The parameters to pass to the class's constructor.
        paramTypes - The types of the parameters to pass to the class's constructor.
        Returns:
        The new instance or null if ANY exception is thrown, parameters are missing or the plugin does not exist in the cache.

      • instantiate

        public static <T> T instantiate(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                java.lang.String className,
                                Plugin.ClassExportType classExportType,
                                java.lang.Object[] params,
                                java.lang.Class<?>[] paramTypes)
        Instantiates an object with the specified class name using the class loader for the plugin with the specified name using the plugins cache owned by the Environment.

        Note that the class must have a constructor with a signature consistent with paramTypes

        Parameters:
        pluginName - The plugin name.
        className - The class name.
        classExportType - make sure plugin declares the class as exported for the given export type
        params - The parameters to pass to the class's constructor.
        paramTypes - The types of the parameters to pass to the class's constructor.
        Returns:
        The new instance or null if ANY exception is thrown, parameters are missing, the plugin does not exist in the cache, or the plugin didn't declare the class as exported for the given export type.

      • instantiateWithException

        public static <T> T instantiateWithException(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                             java.lang.String className,
                                             Plugin.ClassExportType classExportType,
                                             java.lang.Object[] params,
                                             java.lang.Class<?>[] paramTypes)
                                      throws GeneralException
        Instantiates an object with the specified class name using the class loader for the plugin with the specified name using the plugins cache owned by the Environment.

        Note that the class must have a constructor with a signature consistent with paramTypes

        Parameters:
        pluginName - The plugin name.
        className - The class name.
        classExportType - make sure plugin declares the class as exported for the given export type
        params - The parameters to pass to the class's constructor.
        paramTypes - The types of the parameters to pass to the class's constructor.
        Returns:
        The new instance
        Throws:
        GeneralException - if ANY exception is thrown, parameters are missing, the plugin does not exist in the cache, or the plugin didn't declare the class as exported for the given export type.

      • instantiate

        public static <T> T instantiate(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                java.lang.String className,
                                Plugin.ClassExportType classExportType,
                                sailpoint.plugin.PluginsCache pluginsCache)
        Instantiates an object with the specified class name using the class loader for the plugin with the specified name.

        Note that the class must have a default constructor

        Parameters:
        pluginName - The plugin name.
        className - The class name.
        classExportType - make sure plugin declares the class as exported for the given export type
        pluginsCache - The plugins cache.
        Returns:
        The new instance or null if ANY exception is thrown, parameters are missing, the plugin does not exist in the cache, or the plugin didn't declare the class as exported for the given export type.

      • getNameAndFileFromUrl

        public static sailpoint.tools.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getNameAndFileFromUrl(java.lang.String path,
                                                                                            java.lang.String prefix)
        Parses the plugin name and file given path and a prefix. The end of the prefix is the starting point to parse. The path should look like the following: {prefix}/{pluginName}/{file}
        Parameters:
        path - The path.
        prefix - The prefix.
        Returns:
        A Pair containing the name and file.

        Parameters:

        file - The file.
        Returns:

      • isAuthorizedForContent

        public static boolean isAuthorizedForContent(java.lang.String requiredRight,
                                             java.lang.String regex,
                                             sailpoint.plugin.PageContentRequest contentRequest)
        Determines if the content should be included on the specified page for the user with the specified rights.
        Parameters:
        requiredRight - The required right.
        regex - The regex.
        contentRequest - The context of the page content request.
        Returns:
        True if authorized for snippet, false otherwise.

      • isPluginValidForSystemVersion

        public static boolean isPluginValidForSystemVersion(Plugin plugin,
                                                    java.lang.String systemVersion)
        Determines if the plugin min and max system version configuration is valid for the current system version.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin.
        systemVersion - The system version.
        Returns:
        True if valid, false otherwise.

      • isEqualOrDowngrade

        public static boolean isEqualOrDowngrade(Plugin prev,
                                         Plugin next)
        Determines whether a plugin upgrade is a reinstall of the same version or a downgrade to an earlier version.
        Parameters:
        prev - The previous version.
        next - The new version.
        Returns:
        True if next is an equal or lower version, false otherwise.

      • isMinUpgradableVersionMet

        public static boolean isMinUpgradableVersionMet(Plugin prev,
                                                Plugin next)
        Determines if a plugin is upgradable based on any min upgradable version that is set.
        Parameters:
        prev - The previous version.
        next - The new version.
        Returns:
        True if upgradable, false otherwise.

      • isVersionGreaterThanOrEqual

        public static boolean isVersionGreaterThanOrEqual(java.lang.String first,
                                                  java.lang.String second)
        Used to compare two string versions and return true if the first string version is numerically greater than or equal to the second string version.
        Parameters:
        first -
        second -
        Returns:
        True if first string version is numerically greater than or equal to the second string version. False otherwise or if either string is null.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • audit

        public static void audit(java.lang.String auditEvent,
                         Plugin plugin,
                         SailPointContext context)
                  throws GeneralException
        Adds a Plugin Audit Event to the system
        Parameters:
        auditEvent - The type of Plugin AuditEvent to log
        plugin - The plugin
        context - The SailPoint Context
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • isRestrictedPackage

        public static boolean isRestrictedPackage(java.lang.String packageName)
        Check if the given package name is one that is restricted by IdentityIQ from being exported from a plugin.

        Currently, the following are restricted: - empty package - package "sailpoint" - any package that starts with "sailpoint." - package "java" - any package that starts with "java."

        Parameters:
        packageName - the package name to check
        Returns:
        true if restricted (forbidden), otherwise false
